meanings.definition: To put a new tread on (a worn tire).
meanings.sent1: The mechanic retreaded the old tire to make it safe for driving.
meanings.sent2: He decided to retread the worn-out tire instead of buying a new one.
meanings.sent3: The tire joked that it felt like it was getting a makeover when it got retreaded.
meanings.sent4: She retreaded the tire with care, like giving it a fresh start.
meanings.sent5: The process of retreading the tire made it look brand new again.

meanings.definition: To rework or revive (an idea or product) that has been used before.
meanings.sent1: The company retreaded their old marketing strategy to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: She retreaded the successful campaign from last year to use it again.
meanings.sent3: The team retreaded the idea so many times that it started to feel like a new creation.
meanings.sent4: He retreaded the concept with a fresh perspective, making it more appealing.
meanings.sent5: The way she retreaded the old product breathed new life into it.
